item.title: WIRED Roundup: How Charlie Kirk Changed Conservative Media
item.description: On this episode of “Uncanny Valley,” we discuss the legacy of Charlie Kirk and the aftermath of his murder.

item.title: Hasan Piker Will Never Run for Office
item.description: The Twitch streamer could pivot from influencer to candidate. But he tells WIRED’s Big Interview podcast he’d rather use his platform to tell Dems “you can’t podcast your way out of this problem.”

item.title: Where's the Fun in AI Gambling?
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we break down the role of AI in the online gambling scene.

item.title: Onion CEO Ben Collins Hasn't Given Up on Print—or Buying Infowars
item.description: A year after relaunching The Onion as a newspaper, Collins visits Uncanny Valley to talk about why “going into something and not ruining it is bravery.”

item.title: WIRED Roundup: Meta’s AI Brain Drain
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we look back at the week’s biggest stories—from the researchers leaving Meta’s new superintelligence lab, to the dark money group funding Democratic influencers.

item.title: This Is How You Log Off
item.description: On today’s episode of Uncanny Valley, our hosts talk to features editor Jason Kehe about everything from screen time limits and the return to flip phones to the romanticization of the early internet.

item.title: Alexis Ohanian’s Next Social Platform Has One Rule: Don’t Act Like an Asshole
item.description: The Reddit cofounder joins WIRED’s “Uncanny Valley” podcast and opens up about his early days in tech, his plans for Digg, the future of women’s sports, and what his immigrant mom taught him about Ame

item.title: WIRED Roundup: The US Chip Manufacturers’ Bonanza
item.description: On this episode of “Uncanny Valley,” our senior business editor joins us to talk about the Trump administration’s deals with chipmakers, OpenAI’s potential $500 billion valuation—and ants.

item.title: How to Become a Vibe Coder
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, WIRED’s senior correspondent Lauren Goode reports back from her brief stint as a vibe coder.

item.title: WIRED Roundup: Why GPT-5 Flopped
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we dig into WIRED’s latest—from crude deportation memes to GPT-5’s negative reception.

item.title: Decoding Palantir, the Most Mysterious Company in Silicon Valley
item.description: This week on Uncanny Valley, we talk about one of the most notorious American corporations. So what does Palantir actually do?

item.title: WIRED Roundup: Unpacking OpenAI’s Government Partnership
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we discuss the week’s news, from bitcoin miners trying to beat Trump’s tariffs to OpenAI’s new deal with the US government.

item.title: The Vibes-Based Pricing of ‘Pro’ AI Software
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, we’re talking about why some chatbot subscriptions are so expensive and how these premium prices were determined on vibes more than anything substantial.

item.title: Is Silicon Valley Losing Its Influence on DC?
item.description: This episode of Uncanny Valley covers black holes, woke AI, and the relationship between Silicon Valley billionaires and the Trump Administration.

item.title: How WIRED Analyzed the Epstein Video
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we dive into the differences between what the US government said about a Jeffrey Epstein video it released and the story told by its metadata.

item.title: Here's What We Know About DOGE 2.0
item.description: DOGE has continued to operate in full force in its post-Elon iteration. Today on Uncanny Valley, we tell you everything you need to know about the agency.
